The question asks if the presence of Red Blood Cell (RBC) casts in urine indicates glomerulonephritis.

RBC casts are cylindrical structures formed in the renal tubules, composed of red blood cells trapped within a protein matrix (usually Tamm-Horsfall protein). Their presence in urine sediment is a significant finding.

Glomerulonephritis is inflammation of the glomeruli, the filtering units of the kidneys
